title: Die Lun√¶ October, 4. 1642. It is this day ordered by the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament: that such persons as will advance horses and armes towards the furnishing of the thousand dragoneirs, ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
publisher: by L.N. for E. Husbands and I. Frank, and are to bee sold at their shops in the Meddle [sic] Temple, and next dore to the Kings Haed [sic] in Fleetstreete-,
notes: Persons willing to advance horses and arms for the dragoons, on the public faith shall be repaid with interest. -- Steele.
Order to print signed: Hen: Elsinge, Cleric, Parliament. D. Com.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
